benchmark_details.name: COCO-Urdu
benchmark_details.overview: COCO-Urdu is the largest Urdu image-caption dataset to date, created by translating and validating a balanced subset of MS COCO, containing 59,000 images and 319,000 Urdu captions with a multimodal quality estimation framework.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To advance multimodal research for low-resource languages by providing a large-scale Urdu image caption dataset and a systematic hybrid quality estimation framework.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Human evaluation was restricted to 200 captions due to budget and time constraints.

data.annotation: Translated captions validated with a hybrid multimodal quality estimation framework.

methods: Quality estimation using COMET-Kiwi, BERTScore, and CLIP-based visual grounding
methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on translation quality and visual grounding consistency.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better translation fidelity and visual-text alignment.
methodology.baseline_results: COCO-Urdu achieves BLEU scores of 0.53 (Refined) and 0.52 (Zero-shot).
methodology.validation: The dataset was validated using reference-free and reference-based evaluation metrics.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: The COCO-Urdu dataset is released under CC BY 4.0, allowing modifications and adaptations with proper attribution.
